catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 877
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: cup raised on inverted conical foot; two bands of irregular rectangular cutouts on foot alternating with bands of incised wavy lines; incised wavy lines around outer lip of cup; steeply domed lid with incised orbiting lines and other waving lines around pull knob
medium: Stoneware with incised design of wavy lines
text: Most clay tomb dishes from the Silla Kingdom feature incised geometric designs or wavy lines, both of which appear on tall base and cover of this pedestal dish. This dish was excavated at a site near Seongju, a regional center in the Silla Kingdom, now a rural area west of the city of Daegu.
title: Pedestal dish with cover
